title: Associate, Real Estate, Global Investments and Portfolio Strategy
description:
Location: New York, US
Job Function: Real Estate
Job Type: Permanent
Req ID: 15468
GIC is one of the world’s largest sovereign wealth funds. With over 2,000 employees across 11 locations around the world, we invest in more than 40 countries globally across asset classes and businesses. Working at GIC gives you exposure to an extraordinary network of the world’s industry leaders. As a leading global long-term investor, we Work at the Point of Impact for Singapore’s financial future, and the communities we invest in worldwide.

GIC Real Estate
We were an early entrant among institutional investors in real estate including traditional private real estate (brick-and-mortar assets), public equities, real estate investment trusts, and real estate-related debt instruments.

Global Investments and Portfolio Strategy (GIPS)
The GIPS team reports to the senior management of GIC Real Estate as a trusted advisor for the CIO, Investment Committee, and Regional Heads on strategic and portfolio decisions. GIPS is responsible for independent deal evaluation, evidence-based investment views, underwriting guidance, strategic and tactical portfolio allocation, performance and in risk management. GIPS is a critical partner to Investment teams in generating long-term returns via impactful and insightful research and integral to the investment and asset management process.

What impact can you make in this role?
You will be part of a team that ranks among the top global real estate investment firms, and handles a multi-billion-dollar Real Estate portfolio globally. You will have wide exposure to real estate markets in the Americas (US, Mexico, Canada, and Brazil) and opportunities for growth in institutional real estate research and portfolio management. You will have direct responsibilities for implementing internal portfolio and risk management frameworks, as well as providing objective insights on market trends and investment potential to senior stakeholders.

What will you do as an Associate?
Provide independent views on deal underwriting assumptions and investment criteria.
Conduct real estate-related research, including statistical analysis, new markets/ sectors and ad-hoc/ thematic research.
Ensure that relevant information is disseminated to the right parties in a timely manner.
Collaborate with Global GIPS team in the development of global investment strategy recommendations, and risk-management tools and policies.
Maintain, enhance and validate economic and real estate research data.
Represent GIPS in both written work products and internal/external communication.
Function as a contact for various existing fund and joint venture relationships

What qualifications or skills should you possess in this role?
1 to 3 years of working experience with an analytical component, e.g., market research analyst, financial analyst, risk management.
Strong analytical thinking capabilities with an interest in real estate investment & research. You enjoy manipulating and distilling large amounts of data and information, and challenge conventional wisdom.
Willingness to learn and develop critical thinking capabilities. Interest in economics, statistics and probabilistic thinking.
Background/prior experience in Real Estate, Finance, Economics, Urban Studies, Statistical Analysis or Business/Investment an advantage.
Familiarity with investment and risk management concepts in the public/private markets an advantage.
Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to write and present ideas succinctly. Ability to weight differing viewpoints and voice own well-considered view.
You are adept at gathering and interpreting data, as well as organizing and presenting results to internal teams. Enjoy collaborating with and understanding perspectives of different stakeholders.
Critical-thinking skills. Ability to digest available information to form logical arguments and conclusions. Enjoy making inferences and validating conclusions with facts, while considering global portfolio context and market uncertainties.
Ownership mindset and goal-oriented. Ability to provide solutions to different stakeholders.
You enjoy being precise and accurate with numbers and inferences while managing multiple priorities.
Must be able to participate in conference calls in the evenings and early mornings. Occasional business travels required.
Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint a must. Familiarity with GIS, Stata, EViews, Tableau, Python or R an advantage.

Work at the Point of Impact
We need to be forward-looking to attract the right people to help us become the Leading Global Long-term Investor. Join our ambitious, agile, and diverse teams - be empowered to push boundaries and pursue innovative ideas, share your views, and be heard. Be anchored on our PRIME Values: Prudence, Respect, Integrity, Merit and Excellence, which guides us in how we make our day-to-day decisions. We strive to inspire. To make an impact.

Flexibility at GIC
At GIC, our offices are vibrant hubs for ideation, professional growth, and interpersonal connection. At the same time, we believe that flexibility allows us to do our best work and be our best selves. Thus, our teams come into the office four days per week to harness the benefits of in-person collaboration, but have the flexibility to choose which days they work from home and adjust this arrangement as situational needs arise.

We are an equal opportunity employer
As an employer, we passionately believe every individual brings with them unique diversity of thought and perspectives to meaningfully enrich perspectives of GIC teams to drive competitive performance. An inclusive environment yields exceptional contribution.

Compensation
Our compensation philosophy reflects several principles. We strive to provide a competitive compensation package to attract and retain talent globally. We pay for performance, and reward sustainable results. Total pay for this position comprises base pay and bonus. The anticipated base salary range for this role is between $111,500 and $148,700. Bonuses, which may form a meaningful proportion of the total pay package, are determined based on company and individual performance.

Learn more about our Real Estate Department here:
https://gic.careers/group/real-estate/
Our PRIME Values
Our PRIME Values
GIC is a values driven organization. GIC’s PRIME Values act as our compass, enabling us to fulfil our fundamental purpose and objectives. It is the foundational bedrock which governs our behaviors, our decision making, and our focus. It informs both our long-term strategy as a firm, and the way we relate to our Client, business partners and employees. PRIME stands for Prudence, Respect, Integrity, Merit and Excellence.

title: Associate Asset Based Lending-Portfolio/Underwriting
description:
320 S Canal Street Chicago Illinois,60606
Position responsibilities primarily include (i) screening prospects for credit worthiness for booking an Asset Based secured loan, (2) managing a small portfolio of asset based borrowers, starting with more deal participations and advancing over time to more challenging borrower structures, and (3) working within a team environment underwriting new Asset Based transactions, which includes modeling/ financial skills, analyzing a borrower’s past performance and be able to make assumptions on future performance, writing skills and attention to detail in understanding and documenting with a credit memo a borrower’s business profile, competitive dynamics, and a business’ risks and mitigants.
Maintains and promotes a client service environment to satisfy and exceed customer needs and expectations. This role will assist making credit decisions and recommendations in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and in compliance with Bank Policies & Procedures.
Recommends credit according to sound credit-granting principles.
Evaluates clients’ ability to repay loans and consults on loan structure and collateral.
Identifies trends in client activities which may be predictive of deteriorating credit quality.
Performs periodic reviews of credit where more frequent monitoring may be appropriate.
Grants loan requests within specified limits, using understanding of credit scoring and risk management concepts.
Monitors covenants of clients within assigned portfolio to identify deteriorating credit conditions and compliance with loan agreement.
Provides accurate financial analysis and risk assessment of new and existing customers.
Partners with internal stakeholders for accurate, detailed client information.
Develops credit information to make lending decisions on new, renewal and extension loans.
Assists in negotiations of terms and conditions of all decisions made via phone and e-mail interaction with clients.
Prepares summary, present facts and offer opinions concerning credit worthiness.
Minimizes BMO’s risk exposure by adhering to internal credit policies and procedures with respect to lending decisions.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
May participate in on-site client visits with other internal stakeholders.
Maintains and promotes a customer service environment which meets and exceeds customer needs and expectations.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically 3-5 years of relevant experience
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth, including Excel modeling skills
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
Compensation and Benefits:
$67,200.00 - $124,800.00
Pay Type:
Salaried
The above represents BMO Financial Group’s pay range and type.
Salaries will vary based on factors such as location, skills, experience, education, and qualifications for the role, and may include a commission structure. Salaries for part-time roles will be pro-rated based on number of hours regularly worked. For commission roles, the salary listed above represents BMO Financial Group’s expected target for the first year in this position.
BMO Financial Group’s total compensation package will vary based on the pay type of the position and may include performance-based incentives, discretionary bonuses, as well as other perks and rewards. BMO also offers health insurance, tuition reimbursement, accident and life insurance, and retirement savings plans. To view more details of our benefits, please visit: https://jobs.bmo.com/global/en/Total-Rewards
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/us/en
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. BMO is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

title: Product Finance & Pricing Analyst
description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.
Our Product Finance & Monetization team is seeking a Pricing Analyst to join our growing team. This team manages Snowflake’s pricing and business models to maximize Snowflake’s long term profitability and growth. In this role, you will formulate pricing proposals based on financial and competitive analysis, develop them into committed pricing initiatives with cross-functional and leadership support, and implement them into sales and operational processes. You will lead analytic efforts to set pricing for regional expansion, new products and feature sets, new service offerings, product/service bundling programs, promotions, pricing policies, price realization analytics and deal/discount approval decisions support. Reporting to the Director, Pricing Strategy and working closely with Finance, Product Management, Product Marketing, Sales Operations and Legal, this is a highly visible role with excellent growth potential.
What you bring: You have an “owner-operator” mindset - You take initiative and are adept at influencing and leveraging external stakeholders to achieve your goals. You like to “think big” - the idea of scaling 10x or 100x doesn’t faze you. You are a “full stack” player; comfortable with ambiguity or unknown data, able to work in lead or support roles across a variety of projects and responsibilities. You have a passion for technology and embrace the transformational role data plays in the market, industry and the world.
IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GET TO :
Work with product management, product marketing, finance and sales to develop new pricing and packaging strategies that maintain strategic and portfolio coherency. You will be a pricing expert for your workload areas and perform detailed analysis on market, customer, and competitors to support Snowflake’s revenue growth
Work with product and finance leadership to design and execute quantitative pricing research (sales / customer survey, conjoint, van westendorp, etc.)
Answer detailed questions around our unit economics via SQL queries. You’re not just tweaking premade queries- you write from scratch. Enable strategic decision making with insightful data
Track and measure pricing KPIs, develop reporting to enable decision making on pricing performance
Become a trusted business partner to our Engineering and Product Management teams on all aspects of our cloud spend. You will be leaned on as an active advisor for cost considerations whenever our infrastructure is involved.
ON DAY ONE WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE :
3-5+ years experience in Finance, Pricing or Management Consulting. Experience working in a SaaS business supporting pricing, finance and/ or business operations teams is strongly preferred
Comfort with big data and strong Excel skills. You know when and how to utilize Excel, and are proficient in SQL and using a BI tools. Python skills are nice to have
Ability to synthesize large data sets and applying analytic frameworks for insights to support business decisions
Bachelor degree in business, statistics, economics, or other quantitative disciplines
You also understand how to juggle competing priorities outside of traditional FP&A to balance against multiple deadlines
Preferred: Experience in analyzing the cost and usage data from AWS, Azure, or GCP. Knowledge of SaaS business models and B2B channel structures, FinOps certification is nice to have
Every Snowflake employee is expected to follow the company’s confidentiality and security standards for handling sensitive data. Snowflake employees must abide by the company’s data security plan as an essential part of their duties. It is every employee's duty to keep customer information secure and confidential.
The following represents the expected range of compensation for this role:
The estimated base salary range for this role is $88,000 - $117,600.
Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Snowflake’s bonus and equity plan.
The successful candidate’s starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) retirement plan; flexible spending & health savings account; at least 12 paid holidays; paid time off; parental leave; employee assistance program; and other company benefits.
Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.
How do you want to make your impact?

title: Financial Analyst II (Remote)
description:
Every day, Heartland, a Global Payments Company, makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our products and unmatched services. Simply, we create meaningful technology centered experiences that enable our customers to prosper. If you want to work like an entrepreneur, support and serve entrepreneurs and bring your expertise to a dynamic team, then Heartland is for you. If it's in your nature to work with a passion to provide tangible solutions for everyone you interact with, then join us and let's see what we can do together.
Pay: $70,000 - $80,000/YR based on experience
Benefits include:
PTO
Floating holidays
Excellent health benefits
Tuition reimbursement
401(k) match
Position Description:
The ideal candidate for this position has strong analytical skills, is detail oriented, and is able to work well in teams in a fast-paced environment. This includes producing accurate, timely reporting and variance analysis, the ability to improve and automate processes, and strong data gathering and presentation skills. This position will support a finance manager or a senior member of the finance team.

Finance Responsibilities:
Provide financial analysis and support across a variety of areas potentially including, but not limited to, P&L forecasting and analysis, consolidation and presentation of financial results, foreign currency analysis, cash flow forecasting and analysis, investor relations support and other ad hoc analysis projects
Develop and maintain complex Excel models, while consistently finding ways to innovate and reduce time to complete key tasks
Produce frequent financial and key performance indicator reports including variance analysis and trending reports
Support the month-end financial close process by analyzing data and identifying errors and inconsistencies
Recommend process improvements to help drive efficiencies for the finance team, including automating current processes
Create and maintain Hyperion financial reports
Support the finance team with other duties and special projects
Requirements:
1-3 years’ experience in a finance or accounting function
Analytical, accurate, detail oriented, and a self-starter able to work in a fast-paced environment
Data mining skills are essential. Able to quickly convert large amounts of data into useable format to support financial decisions.
Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills. Able to work with stakeholders across multiple business functions.
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills
Experience with Oracle EBS, Hyperion Planning and Essbase a plus
BS/BA degree in business or related field is required
Heartland is an equal opportunity employer. Heartland, a Global Payments Company, provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by law. title: Fundamental Research Group Associate (Equities)
description:
“I can succeed as a Fundamental Research Group (FRG) Associate at Capital Group.”

As one of our FRG Associates, you will work closely and collaborate with the Investment Group and peers to deliver valuable insights, research data, and analysis that will be used to help inform investment decisions. Daily responsibilities include financial modeling, researching companies and related industries, facilitating meetings with management teams, sell-side firms and industry specialists, and working as a partner in the investment process. You will work on projects and tasks with growing complexity, seeking direction and guidance from senior leaders as appropriate. You can self-direct and take an interest in professional development, attending trainings and conferences, and identifying skills needed to strengthen your financial acumen, technical capabilities, and research fundamentals.

“I am the person Capital Group is looking for.”
You have a bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, STEM or a relevant field of study.
You're passionate about a career in equity research with a strong interest in investing.
You have extensive experience with financial modeling and fundamental analysis, working with sells-side firms and industry consultants, utilizing research tools, trade publications, online sources, regulatory filings, etc., and interpreting this information to effectively tell a story.
You have a strong desire to continue to develop bottom-up fundamental research skills working in partnership with experienced investment professionals.
You thrive in team settings. You ask good questions, bounce ideas off others and proactively share your perspective.
You enjoy learning new things and can flex to varying work styles and expectations.
You demonstrate intellectual curiosity and analytical skills in areas of high complexity surrounding financial markets and industry trends.
You apply sound judgment in resolving conceptually complex matters.
You work independently on projects by asking relevant questions and using sound judgment to identify appropriate resources and determine appropriate analytical framework.
You apply effective written and oral communication skills with a diverse group of associates in addition to individuals outside the organization.
You collaborate and develop/maintain relationships inside and outside the organization to enable effective completion of business objectives.
Southern California Base Salary Range: $131,596-$210,554
In addition to a highly competitive base salary, per plan guidelines, restrictions and vesting requirements, you also will be eligible for an individual annual performance bonus, plus Capital’s annual profitability bonus plus a retirement plan where Capital contributes 15% of your eligible earnings.
You can learn more about our compensation and benefits
here
.

title: Quantitative Research Analyst
description:
Quantitative Research Analyst
New York
This role is regulated by FINRA.
As a Barclays Quantitative Research Analyst, you will be involved in and responsible for developing quantitative signals, asset allocation models, cross-asset valuation, hedging and portfolio construction. The work will include empirical analysis using both market data and non-traditional data sources and innovative techniques. In addition to being a researcher, you will take part in publishing and marketing the work to clients as well as collaborating with sales, trading desks and other research groups.
Salary / Rate Minimum: $125,000
Salary / Rate Maximum: $175,000
The minimum and maximum salary/rate information above include only base salary or base hourly rate. It does not include any another type of compensation or benefits that may be available.
Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, established in 1690, with a legacy of success, quality, and innovation. We've helped millions of individuals and businesses thrive, creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. An important and growing presence in the USA, we offer careers providing endless opportunity.
At Barclays, we offer a hybrid working experience that blends the positives of working alongside colleagues at our onsite locations, together with working from home. We have a structured approach where colleagues work at an onsite location on fixed, ‘anchor’, days of the week, for a minimum of two days a week or more, as set by the business area (or nearest equivalent if working part-time hours). Please discuss the working pattern requirements for the role you are applying for with the hiring manager. Please note that as we continue to embed our hybrid working environment, we remain in a test and learn phase, which means that working arrangements may be subject to change on reasonable notice to ensure we meet the needs of our business.
What will you be doing?
Being responsible for developing innovative quantitative signals and portfolio strategies across FI and equities
Developing asset allocation models, cross-asset valuation, hedging and portfolio construction
Advising the largest institutional investors around the globe on quantitative aspects of portfolio management across all asset classes on a one-on-one basis
Working on custom projects to help clients with evaluation of investment constraints, beta replication, alpha generation and risk management
Conducting empirical analysis using both market data and non-traditional data sources and innovative techniques
Taking part in publishing and marketing the work to clients as well as collaborating with sales, trading desks and other research groups
What we’re looking for:
A PhD in Finance, Economics, or a closely related field with academic or job market experience in quantitative research
Econometric understanding including time-series analysis/various cross-sectional techniques with understanding of machine learning & textual analysis techniques
Programming self-sufficiency (Python preferred) and the ability to clearly formulate and conduct empirical studies
Excellent verbal and written presentation skills with creativity and ability to work independently or in a team, a must
Skills that will help you in the role:
Familiarity with and understanding of standard financial markets and databases such as Compustat, CRSP, and Factset a plus
Familiarity with Fixed Income is a plus
Where will you be working?
You will be working at our Americas Headquarters at 745 Seventh Avenue. This 32-story office tower is located in Times Square in the heart of Manhattan and features a cafeteria, fitness center and state-of-the-art LED signage on the facade of the building.
#LI-Hybrid
#LI-MB2021

title: Financial Analyst (level 2)
description:
Requisition ID: R10151469
Category: Business Management
Location: Rocket Center, West Virginia, United States of America
Citizenship required: United States Citizenship
Clearance Type: None
Telecommute: Yes-May consider hybrid teleworking for this position
Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America)
Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time
Positions Available: 1
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.
Put your skills to the test by pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. From global defense to sustainment and modernization to mission readiness, your experience and ability will make it a reality. Our programs are built on equal parts of curiosity and collaboration. Our combined effort means our customers can connect and defend millions of people around the world. With Northrop Grumman you’ll have the opportunity to be an essential part of projects that will define your career, now and in the future.
Northrop Grumman Defense Systems is currently seeking a Financial Analyst (level 2) to join our team in Rocket Center, WV, just outside of Cumberland, MD. The Allegany Ballistics Laboratory (ABL) site in Rocket Center designs, develops and manufactures tactical rocket motors, medium caliber ammunition, composite components and end items, and fuze and electronics equipment. For decades, the dedicated and highly skilled team at ABL has supported national security efforts by developing and building defense systems for DoD customers and U.S. allies.

Job responsibilities
The Financial Analyst will assist with tasks across the Program Control, Budgeting, and accounting departments. The selected candidate will also interface with various departments to assist and accomplish tasks for the Finance organization.
Tasks include:
NCTA & Overhead Account analysis & maintenance
Revenue/project maintenance within Costpoint and through interfacing with FSS (Financial Shared Services)
Generation, processing, and invoicing of Intercompany workorders and interfacing with Intercompany counterparts
Consolidation and creation of finance files for various reporting purposes and analyses
Interfacing with Finance Managers in order to schedule meetings, set review agendas, and collaborate on various tasks, as needed
Basic Qualifications (Level 2):
Must have 7 Years of related experience in lieu of degree, or 3 Years of related experience with Bachelors , or 1 Year of related experience with Masters
Must be able to analyze significant amounts of data using MS Office products: Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Strong communication skills and the ability to multitask
Self-motivated and works well in team environment
Attention to detail and accuracy
Must be able to work onsite in Rocket Center, WV
Preferred Qualifications:
Analytical Skills
Initiative, self-starter, adaptable, and high motivation for excellence
Costpoint experience
Salary Range: $62,200 - $93,400
The above salary range represents a general guideline; however, Northrop Grumman considers a number of factors when determining base salary offers such as the scope and responsibilities of the position and the candidate's experience, education, skills and current market conditions.

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.
The application period for the job is estimated to be 20 days from the job posting date. However, this timeline may be shortened or extended depending on business needs and the availability of qualified candidates.

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: Associate, FP&A
description:
About General Atlantic
General Atlantic is a leading global growth investor with more than four decades of experience providing capital and strategic support for over 500 growth companies throughout its history. Established in 1980 to partner with visionary entrepreneurs and deliver lasting impact, the firm combines a collaborative global approach, sector specific expertise, a long-term investment horizon and a deep understanding of growth drivers to partner with great entrepreneurs and management teams to scale innovative businesses around the world. General Atlantic has approximately $83 billion in assets under management inclusive of all products as of December 31, 2023, and more than 280 investment professionals based in New York, Amsterdam, Beijing, Hong Kong, Jakarta, London, Mexico City, Miami, Mumbai, Munich, San Francisco, São Paulo, Shanghai, Singapore, Stamford and Tel Aviv. For more information on General Atlantic, please visit: www.generalatlantic.com.
Position Summary
This position will report to the Vice President – Financial Planning & Analysis, and will have varied responsibilities, including but not limited to assisting in the forecasting and budgeting process, completing financial analysis, and working on ad hoc projects. The candidate must be analytical and posses strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work well under pressure, prioritize their multiple deliverables and have an acute attention to detail.
Responsibilities
Work closely with GA Finance members during quarterly reporting process
Work alongside the FP&A team through the annual budget process
Assist the team with data analysis
Assist with internal reporting to various stakeholders
Help research and answer analytical questions
Run qualitative checks on quarterly statements and communicate issues to team
Assist with various ad hoc projects
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field
Preferred experience of 2-3 years in the financial services industry, private equity or asset management is a plus
Strong analytical and technical abilities, creativity, thoughtful business judgment and professional maturity
High energy level, strong communication skills and intellectual curiosity
Experience with Anaplan and Workday is a plus
Advanced Excel skills
General Atlantic offers a robust reward program to all employees that will support you and your family, maintaining fulfilling, secure and healthy lives now and into the future, which includes but is not limited to medical insurance, retirement savings contributions, mental and physical health resources and an equal pay program that allows you to earn a base salary of $100,000-150,000 USD of which the exact amount offered will be driven by the degree to which you meet role requirements, additional special skills and experience. Additional reward programs, such as annual discretionary bonuses and long-term incentive programs, are available for eligible employees and are offered as recognition for performance and one’s contributions towards the organization’s success.
General Atlantic is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.
By completing this application, you are consenting to General Atlantic’s processing and use of your personal data. Information on how General Atlantic will use and process your data can be found here: https://www.generalatlantic.com/privacy-policy/

title: Associate, Mergers & Acquisitions
Asset Allocation - Portfolio Management Associate
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Global Atlantic Financial Group is a leader in the U.S. life insurance and annuity industry, serving the needs of individuals and institutions. Global Atlantic is a wholly-owned subsidiary of KKR, a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management across multiple strategies and capital markets solutions.

We are looking for a diverse team of talented individuals who reinforce our culture of collaboration and innovation. We are dedicated to the career development of our people because we know they are critical to our long-term success. Join our team and come grow with us.
The KKR-Global Atlantic partnership - The Global Atlantic Story
Greenhouse is our scheduling tool and we communicate through their systems. At times, your email may block our communications. Please be sure to check your SPAM so that you do not miss critical information about our process, including scheduling.
Asset Allocation - Portfolio Management Associate
POSITION OVERVIEW
The Asset Allocation Team defines and implements the strategy for the firm's investment portfolio. Working closely with other teams in the New York Investment Office, Asset Allocation leads the management of Global Atlantic's $150+ billion general account.
A subgroup of the team, Portfolio Management, is responsible for ongoing management of the $150+ billion assets backing existing policies and supports the competitive acquisition of new business onto the balance sheet. Within this team the analyst is expected to:
Participate in the construction of pricing portfolios for new and prospective business
Assess how new investment strategies impact asset-liability management and underlying profitability for Global Atlantic
Work with the Investment Analytics team to build out tools that track investment positioning and performance relative to pricing expectations
Perform analysis on in-force investment portfolios and suggest trades to improve asset-liability alignment.
Collaborate with Risk and Actuarial Teams to assess the impacts of a changing regulatory environment on invested assets
Prepare investment-related materials for senior leadership, board members, regulators, and potential investors
Liaise with portfolio managers and other business teams on ad hoc projects and strategic initiatives
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree with outstanding academic record and 2-5 years of relevant professional experience
Experience in financial markets, portfolio construction, and asset management
Strong background in both Excel and PowerPoint, familiarity with programming languages (Python / SQL) a plus
Familiarity with quantitative concepts and fixed income math
Knowledge of insurance regulatory requirements a plus
Energetic, inquisitive and an initiative to take on high impact projects that cover new ground for the team and the company
Highly professional and team oriented; organized with acute attention to detail
Strong balance of technical and communication skills
Progress towards CFA designation a plus
This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship now or in the future
Various jurisdictions have passed pay transparency laws that require companies provide salary ranges for any positions for which they are accepting applications. Global Atlantic has offices in Atlanta, Batesville, Bermuda, Boston, Des Moines, Hartford, Indianapolis, and New York City. The base salary range posted below is inclusive of the lowest cost of living geography to the highest in which we have a Global Atlantic office.
Global Atlantic's base salary range is determined through an analysis of similar positions in the external labor market. Base pay is just one component of Global Atlantic's total compensation package for employees and at times we hire outside the boundaries of the salary range. Other rewards may include annual cash bonuses, long-term incentives (equity), generous benefits (including immediate vesting on employee contributions to a 401(k), as well as a company match on your contributions), and sales incentives. Actual compensation for all roles will be based upon geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer. Compensation for our more senior positions have a larger component of short-term cash bonus and long-term incentives.
The base salary range for this role is
$155,000 — $175,000 USD

title: Financial Analyst II (Remote)
description:
Every day, Global Payments makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best-in-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our dynamic team and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.
Pay : $70,000 - $80,000/YR based on experience
Benefits include:
PTO
Floating holidays
Excellent health benefits
Tuition reimbursement
401(k) match
Position Description:
The ideal candidate for this position has strong analytical skills, is detail oriented, and is able to work well in teams in a fast-paced environment. This includes producing accurate, timely reporting and variance analysis, the ability to improve and automate processes, and strong data gathering and presentation skills. This position will support a finance manager or a senior member of the finance team.

Finance Responsibilities:
Provide financial analysis and support across a variety of areas potentially including, but not limited to, P&L forecasting and analysis, consolidation and presentation of financial results, foreign currency analysis, cash flow forecasting and analysis, investor relations support and other ad hoc analysis projects
Develop and maintain complex Excel models, while consistently finding ways to innovate and reduce time to complete key tasks
Produce frequent financial and key performance indicator reports including variance analysis and trending reports
Support the month-end financial close process by analyzing data and identifying errors and inconsistencies
Recommend process improvements to help drive efficiencies for the finance team, including automating current processes
Create and maintain Hyperion financial reports
Support the finance team with other duties and special projects
Requirements:
1-3 years’ experience in a finance or accounting function
Analytical, accurate, detail oriented, and a self-starter able to work in a fast-paced environment
Data mining skills are essential. Able to quickly convert large amounts of data into useable format to support financial decisions.
Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills. Able to work with stakeholders across multiple business functions.
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills
Experience with Oracle EBS, Hyperion Planning and Essbase a plus
BS/BA degree in business or related field is required
Global Payments Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.
Global Payments provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by law. Those applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application and/or interview process should notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.

title: Compliance Officer – Full Time - Remote
company_name: University of Virginia Community Credit Union
description:
Description: University of Virginia Community Credit UnionWorking together to strengthen the financial wellness of our members and local communities.
University of Virginia Community Credit Union Members deserve the best, which is why we seek to engage talented and enthusiastic people who have a passion for excellence and a commitment to the credit union ideal of service and financial education. Be a part of something special – a not-for-profit financial cooperative with the social purpose of people helping people.
Compliance Officer – Full Time - Remote
SUMMARY:
This Compliance Officer is responsible for facilitating and assuring the compliance requirements of the Credit Union by administering, enhancing, and executing the Credit Union’s Compliance and Regulatory Management policy and programs under the supervision of the VP of ERM and Compliance. Specific responsibilities include conducting and coordinating risk-based compliance reviews; conducting risk assessments; completing ad-hoc regulatory compliance testing; establishing and reviewing policies, procedures and controls; coordinating and leading required regulatory change, conducting staff training; responding to compliance related inquiries; managing the member compliant process; advising management of emerging compliance issues; and assisting in the execution of the annual ERM and Compliance Plan.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES:
Establish, develop, coordinate and complete compliance reviews and risk assessments along with issuing necessary reporting as well as supporting tracking process for risk control responses and compliance review findings to ensure timely resolution.
Supports the VP of ERM & Compliance in researching and monitoring emerging risks and regulatory compliance matters, keeping current on changes in laws and regulations impacting the Credit Union.
With the VP of ERM & Compliance, assist in advising management on state and federal laws, legal compliance actions, NCUA regulations, and Credit Union policies and procedures.
Reviews, assesses, and determines compliance with all regulations impacting financial institutions.
Assists the VP of ERM & Compliance with the review of agreements, disclosures, policies, procedures and controls where necessary.
Handles compliance inquiries with the support of the VP of ERM & Compliance issued internally with providing appropriate responses and necessary actions to ensure compliance is maintained.
Validates and ensures marketing, advertising, and member facing information, disclosures, and documents are current and meet regulatory requirements.
As new products and services are developed, perform ad-hoc risk assessments and compliance reviews to ensure compliance requirements are met.
Assess and refine the content of the employee compliance training program, including training for new employees as well as ongoing training for all employees and managers.
Assists in review and enhancement of internal policies, procedures, and controls.
Requirements:
QUALIFICATIONS:
3 or more years of Compliance related experience
Exceptional communication skills
A Bachelor’s degree is required
BENEFITS:
We offer an attractive suite of benefits to full-time employees including: Health, Dental, Vision, a 10% company Retirement Plan Contribution after the first year of employment. Employees are eligible for Life Insurance, Long-Term Disability, Health & Wellness Spending Account, Tuition Reimbursement, and Employee Loan Discounts. Full-time employees accrue Paid Time Off starting with 18 days accrual annually, and 13 company paid holidays. Employees are also eligible for Family Forming Leave, and Volunteer Time Off.
Equal Employment Opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental principle at the University of Virginia Community Credit Union & Member Options, LLC, where employment is based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation, pregnancy, childbirth, or a medical condition related to pregnancy or childbirth, national origin, citizenship, disability, age, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

title: Project Finance Associate I
description:
What We're Looking For
To keep pace with growing opportunities at HNTB Washington State, we are seeking a success oriented professional to join us as a Project Finance Associate. The ideal candidate should be proactive, positive, and interested in career growth. This is a great way for you to get your foot in the door and advance with us as our business steadily expands. If you’re ready to join a high performing Project Finance team, please reach out to us.
At HNTB, you can create a career that is meaningful to you while building communities that matter to all of us. For more than a century, we have been delivering solutions for some of the largest, most complex infrastructure projects across the country. With our historic growth, it is an exciting time to join our team of employee-owners.
This opportunity entails being responsible for maintaining project-related financial data in HNTB's project management system, ensuring alignment with current client contracts, including change orders, subconsultant agreements, and approved unauthorized work. The Project Finance Associate supports the project finance team to ensure billing compliance with contractual documents. Responsibilities include coding project costs, such as subconsultant expenses, expense report receipts, and vendor invoices, with appropriate project accounting codes in accordance with standard procedures and contractual requirements to ensure proper entry into HNTB's project management system.
What You’ll Do:
Accurately updates the project management system by translating client and project workplan data based on contract and change order review.
Facilitates the ability to access and charge to project tasks and phases in the project management system.
Ensures project costs are properly coded and allocated by maintaining awareness of project status and adapting financial data as needed due to project changes.
Manages cost transfers to and from projects/tasks.
Supports the project finance team in reviewing and approving project invoices, updating invoice requirements from contractual documents, verifying billed costs, and ensuring compliance with reporting requirements, including insurance certificates and adherence to client systems and formats.
Generates routine internal project financial performance reports for project and office teams.
Reviews vendor/subconsultant invoices for accuracy and contractual compliance, including DBE and insurance certificate requirements.
Obtains necessary approvals and tracks internal workflow status for timely outcomes.
Supports the project team in maintaining client and subconsultant relationships and communicates receivables updates as directed by the finance team.
Assists in subcontracting processes throughout the project lifecycle.
Supports the proposal process, including gross margin analysis, cost proposal development, alignment with the project management system, and client proposal/estimate formats.
Performs other assigned duties.
What You’ll Need:
Associate’s degree, or
In lieu of education, 2 years of relevant work experience
What You'll Bring:
Developing knowledge of GAAP accounting rules

title: Senior FP&A Analyst
description:
DTN is a global leader providing insights and analytics to our customers to feed, fuel, and protect the world. We help people make critical business decisions that impact the agriculture, oil and gas, trading, and weather industries.

It’s a difference you’ve likely felt without even knowing it. From the food on your plate to the gas in your car to the last flight you took, chances are a DTN customer made it possible. And that’s just for starters. That’s why we say, “When our customers prosper, we all win.”
Job Description:
As a Senior FP&A Analyst, you will play a critical role in aligning financial strategies with sales objectives and optimizing operational efficiency. This position requires a seasoned financial professional with expertise in Salesforce utilization, RevOps collaboration, and strategic financial planning.
What you will be responsible for:
Financial Analysis:
Conduct financial analysis to evaluate the company's performance, profitability, and financial health.
Identify trends, variances, and opportunities for improvement in financial performance.
Collaborate with RevOps and the sales team to understand and analyze sales data, performance metrics, and sales pipelines.
Sales Analysis:
Work closely with the Revenue Operations team to align financial goals with overall revenue strategies and operational efficiency.
Engage in regular meetings with RevOps to discuss performance metrics, challenges, and opportunities for improvement.
Salesforce.com:
Utilize Salesforce to gather, organize, and analyze sales data for reporting purposes.
Work with RevOps to establish and maintain data governance practices within Salesforce, ensuring accurate and reliable data for both financial and operational reporting.
Collaborate on data hygiene initiatives to enhance the overall quality of information within the system.
Reporting and Dashboards:
Work with the IT and RevOps teams to create customized Salesforce reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights for both financial and operational stakeholders.
Partner with RevOps to define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that span financial, sales, and operational metrics.
Collaborate on developing comprehensive dashboards and reports that provide a holistic view of the organization's performance.
Forecasting and Planning:
Work closely with RevOps to integrate revenue forecasts into the overall financial planning process, ensuring alignment between sales forecasts and financial projections.
Collaborate on scenario analysis to assess the impact of different operational strategies on revenue outcomes.
Financial Modeling:
Develop financial models to support decision-making processes related to sales strategies, pricing, and resource allocation.
Collaborate with the sales and RevOps teams to refine forecasting models and ensure alignment with business goals.
Perform scenario analysis to assess the impact of different business strategies on financial outcomes.
Communication and Collaboration:
Effectively communicate financial insights and recommendations to both financial and non-financial stakeholders in clear, concise messaging with actionable insights.
Respond to ad hoc analysis requests from sales, RevOps, or senior management.
Foster collaboration between finance, sales, and RevOps teams to ensure a cohesive approach towards achieving business objectives.
Continuous Learning and Development:
Stay informed about emerging trends and best practices in Finance, Planning and Revenue Operations to contribute valuable insights and recommendations.
Collaborate with RevOps in ongoing training programs to ensure that the finance and sales teams are proficient in utilizing Salesforce for optimal results.
Identify opportunities for process improvements in financial, sales, and operational workflows.
What you will bring to the role:
Established business experience in finance or revenue operations.
Proven experience in designing and implementing financial models.
Strong proficiency in Salesforce utilization for financial reporting and analysis.
Excellent analytical, communication, and collaboration skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and organizational abilities.
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
What you can expect from DTN:
Competitive Salary
Unlimited PTO
Flexible working hours
Remote work model
Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Plans
6% 401K matching
Unlimited access to 13k+ courses via learning platform to support career development.
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
The targeted hiring base pay range for this position is between $82,500 and $110,000. DTN is a pay for performance organization, which means there is the opportunity to advance your compensation with performance over time. The actual base pay offered for this position will be dependent upon many factors, including but not limited to: prior work experiences, training/education, transferable skills, business needs, internal equity and applicable laws. The targeted hiring base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for market competitive variable pay and benefits.
#LI-BA1
#LI-remote
Why DTN?

OUR VISION: To be the independent, trusted source of insights to our customers who feed, protect, and fuel the world.

OUR MISSION: Empower our customers with intelligent and actionable insights that exceed their expectations and enable their success on a daily basis.

OUR VALUES: Customer-Focused, Forward-Thinking, People-Centric, Solution-Oriented

We have great benefits at DTN – apply today to find out more!

At DTN, we are an equal opportunity employer. Come join us as we help feed, fuel, and protect the world!
